title: Normalize container_name by worktree in override generation
description:
Add a defensive normalization step in Port's override generation so any service that declares container_name gets a worktree-scoped name in .port/override.yml instead of the fixed upstream value.

Implementation details:
- In generateOverrideContent (src/lib/compose.ts), when iterating services, check service.container_name.
- If present, set serviceOverride.container_name to a deterministic unique value derived from Port project/worktree identity (for example ${worktreeName}-${serviceName} or ${projectName}-${serviceName}), sanitized to [a-z0-9][a-z0-9_.-]* and truncated safely.
- Keep behavior unchanged for services without container_name.
- Continue overriding ports/labels/networks as today.

Tests in src/lib/compose.test.ts:
1) Fixed container_name is rewritten.
2) Rewritten name is stable for a given worktree.
3) Different worktrees produce different names.

Optional follow-up (nice-to-have): emit a warning log when Port detects and rewrites container_name so users understand why port up succeeds where raw compose might conflict.
close_reason: Override generation now rewrites fixed container_name values to deterministic worktree-scoped names with tests for rewrite, stability, and per-worktree uniqueness

title: port down does not offer Traefik shutdown when override.yml is missing
description:
## Problem
In a local port project without an override.yml file, running → Stopping services in port...
✓ Services stopped in port does not prompt to shut down the Traefik service.

## Expected behavior
→ Stopping services in port...
✓ Services stopped in port should still offer to shut down Traefik even when override.yml is absent.

## Notes
This appears to be a local project edge case where Traefik detection/prompting may depend on override.yml existing.
notes:
Revised plan (per product direction):
- Do NOT introduce template files for user overrides.
- Add a single user-editable file: .port/override-compose.yml (scaffolded by port init).
- File contains instructions/examples only by default; no active overrides.
- Render .port/override-compose.yml with PORT_* runtime vars into generated .port/override.user.yml before compose operations.
- Compose precedence: base compose -> .port/override.yml (Port-generated) -> .port/override.user.yml (user layer, last wins).
- If .port/override-compose.yml is missing, skip user layer without error.
- Also fix bug behavior so port down still reaches Traefik shutdown prompt when .port/override.yml is absent.
Scope split: the new override-compose user layer is tracked separately in port-idm. This bug remains focused on ensuring port down still reaches Traefik shutdown flow when .port/override.yml is missing.

title: Add user override-compose.yml layer rendered to .port/override.user.yml
description:
## Goal
Introduce a first-class user override layer for docker compose without requiring users to edit Port-generated files.

## Scope
- Add a user-editable file: .port/override-compose.yml (created by port init).
- The file should contain instructional comments/examples and no active overrides by default.
- At runtime, render .port/override-compose.yml with PORT_* variables into generated .port/override.user.yml.
- Compose precedence should be: base compose -> .port/override.yml (Port-generated) -> .port/override.user.yml (user layer, last wins).
- If .port/override-compose.yml is missing, skip the user layer without error.
- Update docs for behavior and supported PORT_* vars.

## Notes
This is intentionally separate from bug port-gw8, which only covers port down behavior when .port/override.yml is missing.

title: Add 'port kill' command to stop running commands
description: Implement a 'port kill' command that terminates commands currently running via 'port run' (the opposite behavior of 'port run').
